result.geographic_coverage: 111100: United Kingdom (England, Scotland, Wales, Northern Ireland)
result.name: food_chain_total_factor_productivity
result.notes:
Secondary analysis to calculate productivity of the food chain using already published National Statistcs.  Current price estimates of turnover, purchases and labour are deflated using price indices to get volume indices.  Consumption of fixed capital volume series are obtained directly.  Indices are combined to get an index of output and an index of inputs for food retail, food manufacture, food wholesale and non-residential catering.  These combine to give indices for the whole food chain.

Source agency: Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

Designation: Official Statistics not designated as National Statistics

Language: English

Alternative title: Productivity of the food chain

If you require the datasets in a more accessible format, please contact familyfood@defra.gsi.gov.uk

organization.name: department-for-environment-food-and-rural-affairs
organization.title: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs
organization.description:
We are the UK government department responsible for policy and regulations on environmental, food and rural issues. Our priorities are to grow the rural economy, improve the environment and safeguard animal and plant health.

Defra is a ministerial department, supported by 38 agencies and public bodies.

https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/department-for-environment-food-rural-affairs

result.title: Food Chain Total Factor Productivity
